Reviews.Title: “Always good!”
Reviews.Author: tlvfrhm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Red Roof and several others and have always had great service. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff has been friendly and helpful. It is a great place to stay with reasonable prices. I am frequently in Phoenix for overnight trips and usually stay at Red Roof because they are clean, comfortable, and reasonable. Not a 4 star as far as fancy but in my book they are as good as any high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You..”
Reviews.Author: nancyChino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof Inn For 5 days and the Hotel was great. My room was very clean . I had an issue with my air conditioning unit. I called the front desk. I was surprised when Misty from the front desk was at my room to fix the problem with in a few minutes after I called. Most of all I want to thank the staff. Every time I would leave or walk into the hotel they would say Hi or ask me how my day was. I travel to phoenix a few times and I will definitely stay here again . Thank you, Jane (front desk) and Josa. (maintenance) Thanks for making my stay so nice, Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Eddy's the man”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: My family and I were on the tail-end on a very rough and frustrating move accross country when we landed at the RR Inn in Phx. While in line at the desk we witnessed Eddy handle difficult customers and issues, and when it was our turn, he again handled the issues efficiently and very professionally. Later that afternoon my sons and I were looking for a luggae cart to move our luggage. Eddy called around and looked around, but couldn't locate one so he volunteered to help us take the luggage to our room. Eddy seemed to be able to anticipate our neededs, and we had many of them, and provide the needed assistance. Earlier in our trip we stayed at a Red Roof Inn and I wasn't very impressed, but becasue of my experience with Eddy's professionalism I will choose RR Inn first.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Red Roof Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: Oscar M
Reviews.Content: Thanks every one for your help! Especially Michelle Safaley. We having been staying here for over a month and love the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, for the price.”
Reviews.Author: OsidePirate
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here while attending a dog show in Scottsdale. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, they filled my request for a room on the first floor and at the back of the property. I messed up because I should have also requested that I not be next to the stair well. (I think there was a small army staying on the second floor, it was noisy when ten kids tromped up and down the stairs, my fault), The room was clean and as well stocked as one would expect for a budget hotel. Good coffee in the lobby all day. Easy access to the Freeway. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just o.k. for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mtnhike1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2nd week of February 2012. Room was on the 3rd floor. First the positives: Price was only about $70/night. Not noisy at least on the side away from the highway. Convenient to get on interstate hwy 17. Bell road has a lot of shopping, eating, etc. not too far away from the hotel. The shower drained well, the TV worked and the bed was comfortable. Didn't have to test the air conditioner or heater very much. Now the negatives. Cleanliness was o.k. in the shower, the stool, the bed linens, etc. but, the room wasn't clean in general. The rug was worn, the furniture and linens were old and thread bare. Dirt smudges on the wall and dirt in the corners and just generally felt dirty. Hallway rugs were worn and the facility in general is a little run down. Bring your Lysol wiper. Its o.k. for a single adult traveler if your trying to save money but I wouldn't recommend it to a family that is trying to relax for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstryker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a business trip to Tucson that went longer than anticipated. Decided to stay in Phoenix rather than drive the 4 hours home. This hotel is not where I am used to staying...lower budget. That being said, it was ok. Sketchy people staying there but the room was pretty good. The bed was comfortable, but the bathroom did not seem very clean.....what appeared to be a dirty tub mat. Basic room and higher price than it should have been.

Reviews.Title: “Careful what you read”
Reviews.Author: juanwilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our return trip from the west coast. Arrived after sundown and were tired from travelling. Having read all the reviews on TA about this Red Roof site, we opted to give it a try. Check-in was easy enough. The young man at the desk was quite amiable. Based on our research, we even took the advice of others and requested a room on the back side away from the noise of Interstate 17 and on the north side of the building away from smokers at the back exit doors. See we did read the TA reviews. When we opened the room door, we were greeted by a sickeningly sweet aroma, like a cheap public restroom. It looked clean enough, yet quite spartan as the others had stated. Additionally, the beds seemed quite low to the floor as if they were lacking the mattress portion of a box and mattress. And they were more than hard! Unbearably hard. So much so that in the middle of the night, I found myself awake and almost angry at the extreme discomfort. My wife was up at 4A ready to leave and she is NOT an early riser! We got up and left the room in the predawn hours, not even taking the time to shower or clean up for the road. It was that bad. We just wanted out of there! My wife later told me that during the night the smell had seemed to become that of an animal and that the disinfectant smell had come from an attempt to cover it up. All in all, go elsewhere. The inexpensive room is NOT a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Road noise & very slow front desk.”
Reviews.Author: CHCG-JEK
Reviews.Content: Good location but a tad too close to I17 if you are on the wrong side of hotel. Very loud Decent room but nothing special. Third floor smelled a tad funky as you get off the elevator. The front desk guy was totally overwhelmed with one check in and one phone call. Took 15 minutes to check in plus goofy policy & fee for the in room safe. At least interior corridors.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kaileila
Reviews.Content: The staff here is very friendly, and made us feel very welcome. The room is a great room for the price you pay. Don't expect a 5 star room, but for $50/night, it exceeded my expectations. Great location, near a grocery store and a fun bar/restaurant. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great value once again”
Reviews.Author: Sandy592
Reviews.Content: Third time I stayed here. Great value. Very clean. Nice people at front desk. Convenient location. Nice pool area. The only complaint is highway noise. I asked for a quiet room for all 3 stays - they gave me rooms at rear so highway noise did not bother me. Very happy with cost and quality. I wish they had a cheap breakfast other than coffee, but there is a Denny's close by. I do recommend this hotel. It is not the Marriott Desert Ridge, but it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but fit the bill!”
Reviews.Author: cakokoro
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive place to stay and this hotel fit the bill. It is basic -- don't expect frills. There is a pool that looked clean and the lobby is simple but tidy. The hotel grounds are clean as well. The hotel is 100% non-smoking; however, I did not care for people standing right outside the back entrance to smoke. I wish the hotel provided a designated smoking area on the grounds. I had a superior king room with flat screen TV, small fridge and microwave, and in-room coffee and the room was quite comfortable. The only thing it lacks is extra pillows and blankets in the room; my blankets were thin and I could have used another one, but I did not want to disturb the front desk late at night. The hotel is on a frontage road adjacent to I-17, but my room was in the back of the hotel and I did not hear any street noise. I didn't really hear the neighbors, either, except when people chose to chat in the hallway. The neighborhood itself is a bit sad -- there is a half-empty mall around the corner -- but there are plenty of things to do within easy driving distance. Oh, and this is Phoenix, so you will need a rental car if you stay here. Even though the neighborhood is sad, I felt perfectly safe staying here. All in all, for the great rate I had at this hotel, I feel like I got a great value for my travel dollar, and I would stay here again if I needed comfortable, basic accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gerontius42
Reviews.Content: We hadn't ever been to a Red Roof before and frankly we were a bit hesitant since some friends had stayed in a property in Louisiana and said it wasn't the best place. We were going to visit some friends in the morning and this Red Roof was the closest and the prices were great so we decided to try it. We got one of the king rooms with the big work station and Bill, the desk clerk on Saturday when we checked in, said it was newly renovated. It was very clean and looked great. The carpet was a little psychedelic but it went nicely with the room. The room was quiet and the A/C worked wonderfully. Bill was there again on Sunday morning and happily gave us directions to some places nearby. Overall we will definitely stay there again and at other properties in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. I arrived early at noon and they allowed me to check-in early which I appreciate. The hotel looks like it may have been built in the early 1980's and the only real complaint I have is the entrance roadway. When I was there in January, there were potholes 2 feet in diameter and almost a foot deep. I'm not kidding. It was like driving on the moon! I assume they've fixed them by now.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: goyankees1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week to visit family, Check in was quick and easy, room was 242 on the 2nd floor. The room was large, beds were comfortable and had all the immenities you would expect from a Red Roof inn minus a refrigerator and microwave. They had a pool for the hot days I stayed and provided newspapers and cofee each morning, no breakfast. There is a Fry's Grocery store right accross from the hotel, a discount movie theather next door, and many fast food restraunts nearby , including a Crackerbarrell, which always has good food. This property is right off I-17 and Bell Rd, but you dont hear any noise in the room. Over all for the money $44 per night I would reccomend this hotel, just be aware at checkout to tell the person to remove the $1.50 per day safe charge, or it will be included.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive large room.”
Reviews.Author: glyna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last night. The room was very large and very quiet. The hotel is only two miles from a Cracker Barrel. Jane at the front desk went way out of her way to insure that we were happy and comfortable. This hotel is centrally located and close to the freeway, but, not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy592
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night, arrived late, and we were given a quiet room upon request. Room was nicely appointed, very clean, and front desk clerk was so nice. We enjoyed our stay.. I definitely recommend this hotel. It is near a busy interstate 17 highway, but room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “best customer service”
Reviews.Author: rimrock59
Reviews.Content: When we checked in to the Red Roof Inn we were greeted by two of the most helpful and friendly people behind the desk. During our stay, they recommended restaurants and places to see. We love the fact that you have to go past the front desk to get to the rooms. Made us feel much more safe than a room that opens to the parking lot. Room was clean and well kept, free frig and micro. WiFi worked like a charm. And the price was right. Definately worth a look if your trip to Phoenix takes you north along the Black Canyon freeway.

Reviews.Title: “pick this hotel and you won't be sorry....”
Reviews.Author: marti33
Reviews.Content: everyone is so polite and helpful as far as getting directions to eating places, malls or wherever...fast check in-out.....clean, quiet, I stay here everytime I visit phoenix...wouldn't stay anywhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great motel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleDazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in October. Location was fine for me given the reason we were in Phoenix - NFL. Rooms were large, modern and very clean. It's right near a freeway so was a little noise but that faded into the background quickly. Pool was great and the kids loved it. The staff were super friendly - particularly an older chap who checked us in ( Jim might be his name but I can't really remember ). Surrounding area seemed good. Overall nothing negative to say and it was really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Positives and negatives.... (read if you are a coffee drinker)”
Reviews.Author: chacharu
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Red Roof Inn was a decent experience but a couple of things made the hotel come up short for us. We chose the place because our needs were simple and the price was excellent for the long memorial day weekend. We would have preferred a place with the free continental breakfast for the convenience as much as cost. For a small amount extra we got a microwave and fridge (happy with that, btw) and the hotel info claimed to have coffee available in the lobby so we figured we could forgo the free breakfast. That brings me to my first huge complaint. It wasn't exactly coffee that they had--it was one of those little multi-beverage machines that produced a hot brownish coffee-flavored beverage. I think it's actually supposed to be "brewed" but I think they just run some hot water over some instant flake things. Think sanka. Instant coffee would have been preferable. Let me just add that I understand Red Roof Inn is not a fancy hotel and I wasn't expecting Starbucks, just a cup of real coffee. It's not that difficult or expensive to run a coffee maker. And if they don't want to do that, they shouldn't claim to provide it. Okay, I'm obsessing, but I'll bet I'm not the only one who wants a dang cup of coffee in the mornings. Our plan was to purchase a roll or something simple we could heat up for a light breakfast and grab a cup of coffee from the lobby. Well, on to plan B and that meant buying breakfast out. We dealt with it but.... Okay, enough whining over that. My second complaint was that everything seemed to be done on the absolute cheapest-of-the-cheap. We got a tiny little bar of soap for the shower and they have gone to the little single-use shampoo packets instead of the traditional small bottles. Okay, lots of inexpensive places have done that. But it would have been nice to have 2 packets--one for each of us. Cheap. There was only one small trash can for the entire room--none in the bathroom area at all which was inconvenient. And when we had to get an address and directions over the phone and there was no pen or paper in the room. We had a pen but had to scrounge for something to write on. Most inexpensive places still give you a few little sheets of paper. We didn't need fancy stationery and weren't paying for that, but c'mon. There's no frills but this was just plain cheap. Okay, that's the complaints. Nothing we couldn't live with. Otherwise the place was actually very good. The woman who checked up in was very friendly and made us feel welcome. And the clerk when we left was very helpful getting me info to get to the car rental at the airport. The room was cleaner than most and beds were firm and comfortable. Even the air conditioning was good; quiet, easy to adjust and didn't get overly cold or warm which was a pleasant surprise. So except for the few annoyances it's a good place to stay. Just be prepared to provide everything for yourself (including a trash bag) and it's just fine. I might stay there again, depending on the circumstances, but there are other inexpensive choices nearby and I'd probably try one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JenEricTravelers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to my family in Phoenix as well as its super close location to a major Interstate (I-17 Black Canyon Freeway) As we were traveling northbound to the Grand Canyon this location was superb to get right on the highway and go. Staff both nights (we stayed 1-night on either end of our stay) were so friendly and helpful. They really cared about their work. The rooms were basically appointed (although I'm noticing a trend among cheaper hotels - no toilet lids) with a fridge and microwave. Excellent choice for travel routes North and South in/out of Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 5 Star quality service from all staff!”
Reviews.Author: Midi2010
Reviews.Content: My trip to Phoenix required me to be within easy reach of West Bell Road so this Red Roof Inn was perfectly located. The hotel may be rated 2 Star but you get an outstanding 5 Star quality service from all the staff. The Manager, Front Desk and Housekeeping staff were always very pleasant and extreemely helpful.....nothing was too much trouble! My room (room 342) was perfect for my needs....not only was it very clean, quiet, safe and secure, it was massive and full of light...wonderful! Other benefits which I found very useful were free wi fi, free local telephone calls and outdoors heated pool. All in all I was most impressed with this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great, but lacking in important areas”
Reviews.Author: roseneko
Reviews.Content: It pains me to only give these folks an "average" rating, because they're really quite good in many areas. The hotel itself was clean and well maintained, the room equally so; the front desk staff was cheerful, friendly and helpful (both coming and going, something of a rarity when you check in late); the room and bathroom surprisingly spacious; the rooms well-insulated from highway noise. If these are the factors that are important to you, it's likely to be well worth your money to stay there. Unfortunately, for us these efforts were overshadowed by a couple of significant negatives. The first and biggest one - the beds were rock-hard! I realize some people prefer firmer mattresses, and I usually have a pretty wide range of tolerance, but these were seriously only half a step up from sleeping on the floor. I kept trying (and failing) to get comfortable - once I even woke up with half my ribcage numb from lack of circulation! I'm very glad we were only staying there the one night, because if it had been longer I would've broken the reservation and found another hotel. I can forgive a lot of things, but the whole point of staying at a hotel is to be more comfortable than you would be, say, sleeping in your car - which I thought about doing that night. The other major negative for us was the wireless Internet access. My husband and I are true Internet geeks, so free wi-fi availability is important to us in choosing a hotel. To their credit, there was wi-fi and it was complimentary - but it was through T-Mobile's service and you needed a PIN from the front desk to log in, and they would only give you one per room. I realize that not every family sits around at their separate laptops for hours like my husband and I do, and it wasn't a great inconvenience for one night (fortunately I'd brought a book as well), but only being able to put one computer online when the hotel had advertised unrestricted free wi-fi was quite frustrating for us. A lot of the frustration really stemmed from the price point - if this had been, say, a $40 a night hotel, I would've accepted the downsides and been more pleased with what they did right. But we paid $70 for a double-full-bed room for two people - more like $85 with taxes and fees tossed in. So the aforementioned issues, coupled with a few smaller problems like a single shampoo packet (no bottles, and no conditioner available - I asked) and a complete lack of even an attempt at a breakfast, really stood out. I didn't feel like I'd gotten my money's worth at all. I really do hate saying this because this hotel had some of the friendliest service and nicer rooms I've seen, but unless you regularly sleep on the floor of your house because your bed is too soft, I honestly can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Nites Stay”
Reviews.Author: hnybea
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, always helpful no matter the hour. Rooms are well cleaned including the bathroom. Walking distance to various restaurants, grocery store and movie theaters. Will return to this location, and plan to use the pool next time weather allowing!

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS "OUR" GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: karankay
Reviews.Content: Every once in a while when we have company and the house is full my husband and i give up our bed and head for the Red roof Inn on Bell Rd. and I-17. The rooms are quiet and clean, the staff is very friendly, the location is close to restaurants,grocery stores, gas stations,and more. We live less than 15 minutes away and sometimes we stay here just to takae a brake and be alone. And yes, it is very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lvera
Reviews.Content: Thhis is a budget hotel so you get what you pay for. It was clean and close to amenities. The lady who checked us in was very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest Thanksgiving stay ever”
Reviews.Author: bswarthout1
Reviews.Content: The staff was absolutely great and the value for the price was phenominal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Phoenixarea. The hotel was located very close to all of the attractions our family wanted to visit. Thank You Red Roof Inn for making our family holiday the greatest Thanksgiving yet.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable and As Expected”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel. It is not quite a no-tell motel, but it's close. Don't expect any luxuries. The pool looks fine. I didn't try the breakfast. Still, this is no luxury hotel. It is what you would expect. For a hotel in it's class, this is probably above par. You could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “cheap price, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: emmacbaker
Reviews.Content: 1 night. good location next to the freeway. Could use better beds. Not a place I would spend any amount of time at.

Reviews.Title: “cheap & comfy”
Reviews.Author: txr60
Reviews.Content: looks like it was recently renovated. Room was clean and comfortable but no bells and whistles. No coffeemaker, iron, but take some of the money you saved and go to Circle K for coffee and pick up a $7 iron at WalMart. Need a safe clean comfortable place to rest your head and shower? This is it.

Reviews.Title: “decent rooms for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: tripfan30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine if you are trying to save money. We had the King Business Room. It was clean and a pretty decent size. With the business room you get free WIFI. It is a pretty basic room though. You need to bring all of your own toiletries (I always do but if you don't, you need to here.) The hotel staff are nice enough and for a room that only cost $55, I was happy enough to stay here for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a bad hotel, but not a nice one”
Reviews.Author: FEnriqueCV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RR North on April 11 for 2 nights, I have stayed in other RR hotels in other states but this time I think it was a room that it was not bad so but nice is not also the adjetive to describe it, clean? Yes, it was... but that smelly athmosphere was uncomfortable even for the kids who are very easygoing they realized about this thing. We were changed to another room with better results, but in average this hotel needs a renovation asap in order to qualify as a chain brand. I would stay there only if there is no other hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn in Phoenix in March of 2006 and ended up moving to another hotel after one night. While the price was right, $65 during the very busy baseball Spring Training/Spring Break time, the hotel was average. There were very few ammenities and we had a lot of problems with our air conditioning, which can make a stay in Phoenix quite uncomfortable. There are a few sports bar/restaurant type places within walking distance (e.g. Applebee's), which was convenient, but the location is basically within a strip mall. If you are looking for a bargain hotel that you are just sleeping at, this place would be great, but if you actually want to enjoy your stay in between your other activities, I would suggest an upgrade. The staff was very nice however.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Phoenix North
HotelInfo.Address: 17222 N. Black Canyon Highway, Phoenix, AZ 85053
